entry.title: Genoa Conservatory (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that after Nazi Germany placed anti-aircraft batteries on the property of the Genoa Conservatory, the school moved into the Villa Saluzzo Serra (pictured) art museum to maintain the safety of its students?

entry.title: Vivi Vassileva (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Vivi Vassileva, a percussionist who was the youngest member of the German national youth orchestra, has played Gregor Mayrhofer's Recycling Concerto on instruments derived from garbage?

entry.title: build dioramas (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that some California schoolchildren build dioramas when learning about their state's Spanish missions?

entry.title: Thomas J. Wright (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Thomas J. Wright's PhD dissertation focused on US–Soviet relations in the late 1940s?

entry.title: Wrexham and East Denbighshire War Memorial Hospital (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Wrexham and East Denbighshire War Memorial Hospital was designed with balconies to treat patients with tuberculosis?

entry.title: M'liss McClure (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that actress M'liss McClure's publicity agency promoted her "almost telescopic vision" as a selling point?

entry.title: Huequi (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that 2.5-metre-tall (8.2 ft) white rock spires grow at the volcano Huequi?

entry.title: statue of RoboCop (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Detroit has been waiting for its statue of RoboCop for more than 12 years?
